auth0.desc:
Why worry about login when Auth0
can do it for you? Auth0 can even
handle the UI for your login and
signup pages. Keep your app and user
data secure and let someone else
worry about the details.
auth0.subtitle: Hosted Auth Provider
auth0.title: Auth0

babel.desc:
With Babel, Redwood can perform
some neat tricks, like never needing
to import "react" into your components.
Easily extendable with your own
plugins.
babel.subtitle: JavaScript Compiler
babel.title: Babel

baremetal.desc:
Deploy to your own servers however
want with Redwood's built in
Baremetal deploy option! Who needs
the cloud when you've got BIG IRON
serving your app? Faster response
times and more control.
baremetal.subtitle: Deploy Engine
baremetal.title: Baremetal

clerk.desc:
Add password, magic link, email, sms,
social, and web3 logins with
just a couple of lines of code.
Optionally handle user profiles,
team onboarding and more!
clerk.subtitle: Hosted Auth Provider
clerk.title: Clerk

dbauth.desc:
Redwood's own self-hosted auth
option that provides signup, login, and
forgot password flows. Keep your
user data in your own database and
style your UI however you want.
dbauth.subtitle: Self-hosted Authentication
dbauth.title: dbAuth

firebase.desc:
If you want auth backed by one of
the biggest companies in the world,
you probably want Firebase
 (and Google). Easily add signup and
login for the the big guys: Facebook,
Twitter, GitHub, Apple, and more.
firebase.subtitle: Hosted Auth Provider
firebase.title: Firebase

flightcontrol.desc:
Flightcontrol provides an easy
git-push deploy experience on your
own AWS account. Deploy your 
frontend, backend, and DB all
together with incredible DX
and performance.
flightcontrol.subtitle: Fullstack Hosting
flightcontrol.title: Flightcontrol

graphql.desc:
Fully featured, performant and
extendable GraphQL JS server.
Redwood automatically creates
resolvers from plain JS functions
making your business logic
shareable across your backend.
graphql.subtitle: API Engine
graphql.title: GraphQL

jest.desc:
Redwood augments Jest with
"Scenarios" making it easy to setup
your database for a given scenario,
plus GraphQL mocking with MSW to
easily test data flow.
jest.subtitle: Testing Framework
jest.title: Jest

layer0.desc:
Layer0 not only hosts your static
content, but provides server-side
rendering for web appsand caches
both your APIs and HTML at the
network edge.
layer0.subtitle: Build & Deploy
layer0.title: Layer0

netlify.desc:
Distribute your frontend across
Netlify's custom CDN, run your GraphQL
endpoint and custom functions
with AWS Lambda, and get access to
additional features like background
workers, forms, analytics, and more.
netlify.subtitle: Build & Deploy
netlify.title: Netlify

nhost.desc:
Nhost is an open source alternative
to Firebase, integrated with its
GraphQL API and permissions from
Hasura. Includes email/password,
magic link, SMS, social logins, and more.
nhost.subtitle: Hosted Auth Provider
nhost.title: Nhost

prisma.desc:
Supporting SQLite, PostgreSQL
MySQL, SQL Server, MongoDB
and CockroachDB, this flexible
ORM also helps manage your schema
with versioned migrations.
prisma.subtitle: Database Access & ORM
prisma.title: Prisma

react.desc:
The world's most popular rendering
engine powers Redwood's web
frontend. And just wait until you
you try Redwood's router:
inspired by Ruby on Rails and React
Router, it's declarative and simple.
react.subtitle: Frontend Rendering
react.title: React

render.desc:
Render is a unified cloud to build
and run all your apps and websites
with TLS certificates, a global CDN,
DDoS protection, private networks,
and auto deploys from Git.
render.subtitle: Fullstack Cloud
render.title: Render

serverless.desc:
Deploy to your own cloud host, but
orchestrated by Serverless's CLI
tools. Define your infrastructure in
code, Serverless handles starting
and connecting services and scaling
them as needed.
serverless.subtitle: Deploy Orchestration
serverless.title: Serverless

storybook.desc:
Build your UI in isolation and easily
view and catalog your components
in every possible state. You'll end
up with a comprehensive design
reference for free!
storybook.subtitle: UI Component Builder
storybook.title: Storybook

supabase.desc:
Your application needs a database,
and Supabase has just the thing:
an open source Firebase alternative,
compatible with PostgreSQL. They can
also host your authentication client,
provide storage, and more.
supabase.subtitle: Auth & Database Provider
supabase.title: Supabase

typescript.desc:
Redwood is completely typed,
front and backend. It watches
your schema and GraphQL
definitions for changes,
generating types on the fly.
typescript.subtitle: JavaScript + Types
typescript.title: TypeScript

vercel.desc:
A global edge networking gets your
code as close to the end user
as possible. SSL, asset compression
and cache invalidation are easy.
Preview and collaborate on changes.
vercel.subtitle: Build & Deploy
vercel.title: Vercel

webpack.desc:
Prepare your assets for production
with the most widely used bundler
in the world today. Enjoy a zero config
experience out of the box, but
with the ability to customize when
the time comes.
webpack.subtitle: Module Bundler
webpack.title: Webpack
